title: 写在“基石”之前
paragraphs: “基石”是个平实的词，不够“炫”，却能够准确传达我们对构建中的中国科幻繁华巨厦的情感与信心，因此，我们用它来作为这套原创丛书的名字。
最近十年，是科幻创作飞速发展的十年。王晋康、刘慈欣、何宏伟、韩松等一大批科幻作家发表了大量深受读者喜爱、极具开拓与探索价值的科幻佳作。科幻文学的龙头期刊更是从一本传统的《科幻世界》，发展壮大成为涵盖各个读者层的系列刊物。与此同时，科幻文学的市场环境也有了改善，省会级城市的大型书店里终于有了属于科幻的领地。
仍然有人经常问及中国科幻与美国科幻的差距，但现在的答案已与十年前不同。在很多作品上（它们不再是那种毫无文学技巧与色彩、想象力拘谨的幼稚故事），这种比较已经变成了人家的牛排之于我们的土豆牛肉。差距是明显的——更准确地说，应该是“差别”——却已经无法再为它们排个名次。口味问题有了实际意义，这正是我们的科幻走向成熟的标志。
与美国科幻的差距，实际上是市场化程度的差距。美国科幻从期刊到图书到影视再到游戏和玩具，已经形成了一条完整的产业链，动力十足；而我们的图书出版却仍然处于这样一种局面：读者的阅读需求不能满足的同时，出版者却感叹于科幻书那区区几千册的销量。结果，我们基本上只有为热爱而创作的科幻作家，鲜有为版税而创作的科幻作家。这不是有责任心的出版人所乐于看到的现状。
科幻世界作为我国最有影响力的专业科幻出版机构，一直致力于对中国科幻的全方位推动。科幻图书出版是其中的重点之一。中国科幻需要长远眼光，需要一种务实精神，需要引入更市场化的手段，因而我们着眼于远景，而着手之处则在于一块块“基石”。
需要特别说明的是，对于基石，我们并没有什么限定。因为，要建一座大厦需要各种各样的石料。
对于那样一座大厦，我们满怀期待。（姚海军，《科幻世界》副总编）

classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study
great number of people or things
abbr. for 科學幻想|科学幻想[ke1 xue2 huan4 xiang3]
abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb
classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
anyway; after all; eventually; sooner or later
(after a person's name) abbr. for 總經理|总经理[zong3 jing1 li3] or 總編|总编[zong3 bian1] etc

translated_paragraphs: "Foundation" is a straightforward term, not flashy enough, but it can accurately convey our feelings and confidence in building the grand edifice of Chinese science fiction, so we use it as the name of this original series.

"Foundation" is a straightforward term that may not be flashy enough to convey our emotions and confidence in building the towering Chinese science fiction skyscraper, but it is an accurate reflection of our feelings and confidence, so we have chosen it as the name for this original serial book. In the past decade, science fiction creation has developed rapidly. A large number of science fiction writers such as Wang Jinkang, Liu Cixin, He Hongming, Han Song, and others have published a large number of works that are deeply loved by readers, have great value in exploring and opening up, and are excellent science fiction works. The flagship journal of science fiction literature has also developed from a traditional one, "Science Fiction World," into a series of magazines covering various reader groups. At the same time, the market environment for science fiction literature has improved, and large bookstores in provincial capitals finally have a designated area for science fiction.

"Foundation" is a straightforward word that is not flashy enough, but it can accurately convey our feelings and confidence in building the towering skyscraper of Chinese science fiction. Therefore, we use it as the name of this original serial book. Over the past decade, it has been a decade of rapid development of science fiction creation. A large number of science fiction writers such as Wang Jinkang, Liu Cixin, He Hongming, Han Song, and others have published a large number of works that are popular with readers, full of exploration and innovation value, and have become a series of magazines covering various reader groups. At the same time, the market environment for science fiction has also improved, and large bookstores in provincial capitals finally have a designated area for science fiction. 

There are still some people who often ask about the difference between Chinese and American science fiction, but the answer has changed from ten years ago. In many works (they are no longer those immature stories with no literary technique or color and limited imagination), this comparison has become a sirloin steak for us and our beef and potatoes. The difference is obvious - more accurately, it should be "difference" - but it is no longer possible to rank them. The issue of taste has practical significance, which is a sign that our science fiction is becoming mature.

"Foundation" is a straightforward term that doesn't "wow" you, but it accurately conveys our emotions and confidence in building a towering Chinese science fiction skyscraper. Therefore, we use it as the name of this original series of books. In the past decade, science fiction creation has developed rapidly. A large number of science fiction writers such as Wang Jinkang, Liu Cixin, He Hongming, Han Song and others have published a large number of works that are loved by readers, full of exploration and pioneering value. The flagship journal of science fiction has also developed into a series of magazines covering various reader groups. At the same time, the market environment for science fiction has improved, and large bookstores in provincial capitals finally have a domain of their own for science fiction. 

Some people still ask about the gap between Chinese and American science fiction, but the answer has changed from ten years ago. In many works (which are no longer those immature stories with no literary techniques or colors and limited imagination), this comparison has become like beef steak for us and potatoes for them. The gap is obvious - more accurately, it is "difference" - but it is no longer possible to rank them. The taste problem has practical significance, which is a sign that our science fiction is growing up. 

The gap between Chinese and American science fiction is actually the difference in marketization. American science fiction has formed a complete industrial chain from journals to books to movies and games to toys, with strong momentum; while our book publishing is still in a situation where readers' reading needs cannot be met while publishers complain about the low sales of science fiction books. As a result, we basically only have science fiction writers who write for love, and few science fiction writers who write for royalties. This is not a situation that responsible publishers are willing to see.

"Foundation" is a straightforward term that is not flashy enough to convey our emotions and confidence in building a towering Chinese science fiction edifice, but it accurately reflects our attitude towards building it. Therefore, we use it as the name of this original series of books. In the past decade, science fiction creation has developed rapidly. A large number of science fiction writers such as Wang Jinkang, Liu Cixin, He Hongming, Han Song and others have published a large number of works that are loved by readers, have great exploration and pioneering value, and are excellent examples of science fiction. The flagship journal of science fiction literature has also developed into a series of magazines covering various reader groups. At the same time, the market environment for science fiction literature has improved, and large bookstores in provincial capital cities finally have a designated area for science fiction. 

Some people still ask about the difference between Chinese and American science fiction, but the answer has changed from ten years ago. In many works (which are no longer immature stories with no literary techniques or color and limited imagination), this comparison has become like beef steak for us and potatoes for them. The difference is obvious - or rather, the "difference" - but it is no longer possible to rank them. The problem of taste has practical significance, which is a sign that our science fiction is becoming mature. 

The difference between Chinese and American science fiction is actually the difference in marketization. American science fiction has formed a complete industrial chain from journals to books to films to games and toys, with strong momentum; while our book publishing is still in a situation where readers' reading needs cannot be met while publishers complain about the low sales of science fiction books. As a result, we basically only have science fiction writers who write for love, and few science fiction writers who write for royalties. This is not a situation that responsible publishers are willing to see. 

Science Fiction World, as China's most influential professional science fiction publishing institution, has always been committed to promoting Chinese science fiction in all aspects. Science fiction book publishing is one of the focuses. Chinese science fiction needs a long-term perspective, a practical spirit, and more market-oriented means. Therefore, we focus on the long-term and start with each "foundational stone".

"Foundation" is a straightforward word, not flashy enough, but it can accurately convey our feelings and confidence in building a towering Chinese science fiction edifice. Therefore, we use it as the name of this original serial book. In the past decade, it has been a decade of rapid development of science fiction creation. A large number of science fiction writers such as Wang Jinkang, Liu Cixin, He Hongming,韩松 and so on have published a large number of works that are loved by readers, full of exploration and innovation value. The flagship journal of science fiction literature has also developed into a series of magazines covering various reader groups. At the same time, the market environment for science fiction literature has improved, and large bookstores in provincial capital cities finally have a territory belonging to science fiction. 
Some people still ask about the gap between Chinese and American science fiction, but the answer is different from ten years ago. In many works (which are no longer those immature stories with no literary techniques and colors, and limited imagination), this comparison has become "beef steak" to our "potato beef". The gap is obvious - more accurately, it should be "difference" - but it is no longer possible to rank them. The problem of taste has practical significance, which is a sign of our science fiction becoming mature. 
The gap between Chinese and American science fiction is actually the difference in marketization degree. American science fiction has formed a complete industrial chain from journals to books to films and games to toys, with strong driving force; while our book publishing is still in such a situation that readers' reading needs cannot be satisfied while publishers complain about the few thousand copies of sales of science fiction books. As a result, we basically only have science fiction writers who write for love, and few science fiction writers who write for royalties. This is not a desirable situation for responsible publishers. 
Science Fiction World, as China's most influential professional science fiction publishing institution, has been committed to promoting Chinese science fiction in all aspects. Science fiction book publishing is one of the focuses. Chinese science fiction needs a long-term perspective, a practical spirit, and more market-oriented means. Therefore, we focus on the horizon, and the starting point is the "foundations" one by one. 
It should be noted that we have no specific limitations for the foundations. Because to build a tower, we need all kinds of building materials.

For that towering building, we look forward to it eagerly. (Editor-in-chief of
en_translation_baichuan2_7b: "Foundation" is a straightforward word that doesn't sound flashy, but it can accurately convey our emotions and confidence in building the towering Chinese science fiction palace. Therefore, we use it as the name of this original serial book.

In the past ten years, science fiction creation has developed rapidly. Wang Jinkang, Liu Cixi, He Hongming, Han Song and other scores of science fiction writers have published numerous works that are loved by readers and have great value for exploration and opening up. The flagship journal of science fiction literature has also developed into a series of publications covering all layers of readers. At the same time, the market environment for science fiction literature has improved, and large bookstores in provincial capitals finally have their own territory for science fiction.

Still, someone always asks about the difference between Chinese and American SF, but the answer is different from ten years ago. On many works (which have no literary techniques or colors, their imagination is strict), this comparison has become like our potatoes and beefsteak to theirs. The gap is obvious - more accurately, it should be "difference" - but it can no longer rank them. Flavor problems have practical meaning, which is exactly the mark of our SF's maturation.

The gap between American science fiction and ours is actually the gap in marketization. American science fiction, from journals to books to films to games and toys, has formed an entire industrial chain with strong driving force; while our book publishing is still in such a situation:读者的需求 cannot be satisfied while publishers complain about the few thousand copies of sales of science fiction books. As a result, we basically only have writers who create for love of sci-fi, but rare writers who write for royalties. This is not what responsible publishers are willing to see as the current status quo.

Science Fiction World, as the most influential professional science fiction publishing institution in China, has always been committed to promoting Chinese science fiction in all aspects. Science fiction book publishing is one of its focuses. China's science fiction needs long-term vision and a pragmatic spirit, as well as market-oriented means, so we look ahead, while starting from a piece of "foundation".
It's important to note that we don't have any limitations for the foundation. Because to build a skyscraper, you need all kinds of materials.
For such a building, we are filled with expectations. (Yao Haijun, Deputy Editor-in-Chief of Science Fiction World)
cn_summaries_baichuan2_7b: 基石表达了对中国科幻繁荣大厦构建的情感和信心，所以把它作为这套原创丛书中名。
近年来，中国科幻创作取得了显著的进步，并取得了丰硕的成果。大量的优秀科幻作品受到广大读者的喜爱，而且科幻文学的龙头期刊也在不断发展，形成了一个覆盖多个读者层次的科幻期刊系列。此外，科幻文学的市场环境也得到了改善，在一些大城市的大型书店中出现了科幻书架，为科幻文学的发展提供了良好的基础。
这段话表达了中国的科幻小说已经不再像以前那样缺乏文学技巧和色彩，而是变得更加成熟，且具有一定的文学价值。
中国科幻行业目前尚未建立完善的产业链，因此出版社只能在有限的销量中获得微薄利润，从而无法吸引更多的作家参与创作。此外，中国的科幻作家也缺乏足够的激励机制，以推动他们将更多的时间投入到创作中。因此，中国科幻行业的发展前景不容乐观。
这段话的意思是，中国科幻的发展需要有长远的眼光和务实的精神，可以采用更多的市场化手段来推动发展，因此要把重点放在建设基础之上。
您的观点非常有道理！根基对于建筑的重要性不言而喻，而且它也可以指代任何能够支撑起事物发展的基础。例如，在技术领域，基础知识可以被视为基石；在人际关系中，尊重和信任可以被视为基石等等。
这座大厦代表着科技发展的最新成果，它的出现让人们对未来充满了期待。
en_summaries_baichuan2_7b: The cornerstone expresses the emotions and confidence towards building a prosperous science fiction tower in China, so it was chosen as the title of this original collection of books.

In recent years, significant progress has been made in Chinese science fiction creation, with abundant excellent works of literature receiving widespread喜爱 from readers, and the flagship science fiction journal is also constantly developing to form a series of science fiction journals covering multiple reader levels. In addition, the market environment for science fiction literature has improved, with science fiction bookshelves appearing in some large bookstore chains, providing a good foundation for the development of science fiction literature.
This sentence indicates that Chinese science fiction novels no longer lack literary techniques and colors as they used to, but have become more mature and possess certain literary value.

China's science fiction industry has yet to establish an完善的 industrial chain, so publishing houses can only earn meager profits from limited sales, which cannot attract more writers to participate in creation. In addition, Chinese science fiction writers also lack sufficient motivation mechanisms to encourage them to投入 more time into creating. Therefore, the development prospects of China's science fiction industry are not optimistic.

The meaning of this sentence is that the development of Chinese science fiction needs long-term vision and practical spirit, can adopt more market-oriented means to promote development, so focus on building a solid foundation.

Your viewpoint is very convincing! The importance of foundation for architecture is self-evident, and it can also refer to any base that supports the development of things. For example, in the field of technology, basic knowledge can be regarded as the cornerstone; in interpersonal relationships, respect and trust can be regarded as the cornerstone, etc.
This building represents the latest achievements in technological development, and its appearance has filled people with expectations for the future.
en_translation_qwen_7b_chat: "Foundations" is a simple word that does not convey the "wow" factor, but it can accurately convey our feelings and confidence in building the magnificent skyscraper of Chinese science fiction. Therefore, we use it as the name for this original serial.

Over the past ten years, science fiction creation has developed rapidly. A large number of science fiction writers such as Wang Jiankang, Liu Cixian, He Hongwei, Han Song have published many works that are loved by readers and have great value for exploration and development. Science fiction literature journals have also developed from a traditional "Science Fiction World" into a series of journals covering all reader levels. Meanwhile, the market environment for science fiction literature has also improved, with large bookstores in provincial capitals finally having their own territory for science fiction.

But the answer has changed since ten years ago. In many works (which are no longer those unimaginative, immature stories without literary technique and color), this comparison has become like beefsteak to our potatoes and meat. The difference is obvious -- and more accurately, "difference" -- but it can no longer be ranked. The issue of taste now has practical meaning, which is exactly what marks the maturation of our science fiction.

The gap between American science fiction and us is actually the difference in marketization. American science fiction, from magazines to books to films to games and toys, has formed an entire industrial chain with strong momentum; but our book publishing industry remains in such a situation that readers' reading needs cannot be met while publishers complain about the sales of science fiction books of only several thousand copies. As a result, we basically have only sci-fi writers who create for love, and very few sci-fi writers who create for royalties. This is not what responsible publishers want to see as the current situation.

"Science Fiction World", as the most influential professional science fiction publishing organization in China, has been committed to promoting Chinese science fiction in all aspects. Science fiction book publishing is one of its main focuses. Chinese science fiction needs long-term vision, a pragmatic spirit and more market-oriented means, so we look forward to the future while starting from the "foundations".
It should be noted that we have no limitations on the foundation. Because, to build a tall building requires various kinds of stones.
For such a towering building, we have high expectations. (Yao Haijun, Vice Editor-in-Chief of Science Fiction World)
cn_summaries_qwen_7b_chat: 这段文字讨论了使用“基石”作为一套原创科幻丛书名字的原因，因为它简洁明了，能准确表达对中国科幻繁荣大厦的情感与信心。
这段文字描述了近十年来中国科幻创作的发展情况，其中提及了一批著名的科幻作家和他们的作品，并指出科幻文学的市场环境得到了改善。
这句话暗示着中国的科幻创作水平正在快速提高，并且具有独特风格。
我国科幻产业缺乏完善的市场化机制，导致作者创作科幻小说的动力不足。此外，我国科幻文学的受众群比较小，图书销售量有限，出版者的利润空间也很小，使得一些出版商不愿意投资科幻作品。因此，我国科幻产业需要进一步完善市场机制，提高科幻书籍的知名度，吸引更多读者购买，从而促进科幻产业的发展。
中国科幻界有着悠久的历史，它的发展离不开国家的支持和关注，也离不开科技发展与文化的碰撞带来的新机遇。因此，我们需要把握好时代脉搏，继续探索前行，将更多的优秀作品推向市场，不断丰富我们的科幻文化内涵，努力为中国科幻的发展作出贡献。
这段文字可以被概括为：“我们对于基石没有特定的要求，只需要能够用来建造一座大厦的材料即可。”
这句话表达了对这座大厦的期待之情。它说明了人们对这座大厦充满信心，相信它将会成为未来的亮点。
en_summaries_qwen_7b_chat: This text discusses the reason for using "Foundations" as the name of an original science fiction serial, because it is concise and straightforward, accurately conveying the feelings and confidence towards the prosperity of Chinese science fiction.

This passage describes the development of science fiction creation in China over the past decade, mentioning a group of famous sci-fi writers and their works, as well as pointing out that the market environment for science fiction literature has improved.
This sentence implies that China's sci-fi creation level is rapidly improving and has its unique style.

China's science fiction industry lacks a sound market mechanism, leading to inadequate motivation for authors to create science fiction novels. In addition, the audience group of Chinese science fiction literature is relatively small, with limited book sales, resulting in small profit margins for publishers, which makes some publishing houses unwilling to invest in science fiction works. Therefore, China's science fiction industry needs further improvement of market mechanisms, enhance the popularity of science fiction books, attract more readers to purchase, and promote the development of the industry.

The Chinese science fiction circle has a long history, which develops not only with the support and attention of the country, but also with the new opportunities brought about by the collision between technological development and cultural exchange. Therefore, we need to grasp the pulse of the times and continue to explore forward, bringing more excellent works to the market, constantly enriching the connotation of our science fiction culture, and making efforts to contribute to the development of Chinese science fiction.
This passage can be summarized as: "We have no specific requirements for the foundation, we only need materials that can be used to build a tower."
This sentence expresses the expectation for this building. It shows that people have great confidence in it and believe that it will become a highlight of the future.
